page.title: 19BRIDGE OF WEIR - RELIGION
page.content: The oldest church in Bridge of Weir is{Freeland Church,}which was built in the{1820's.}The name "{Freeland,}"is connected with {Robert Freeland}who lived in Gryffe Castle (which is now a children's home). He owned one of the cotton mills which were once the main industry in Bridge of Weir. There are two{Presbyterian Churches in Bridge of Weir, one{Assembly of the {Christian Brethern}and an{Episcopal Church. Their names are{Freeland, {St.Machar's Ranfurly, St.Mary's}and {Hope Hall. As well as organising church services the elders and the minister also care for the sick, housebound and elderly. They comfort the family when a member of the family dies.The church also celebrates births and marriages of its members.
